hioa.android.chess

Class DBAdapter

  • java.lang.Object
    • hioa.android.chess.DBAdapter

  • public class DBAdapter
extends Object
    This class handles all queries towards the database
    Version:
    2013-11-23
    Author:
    Lars Sætaberget

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBAdapter

        public DBAdapter(Context context)
        Create a new adapter for communicating with the database
        Parameters:
        context - The current context

    • Method Detail

      • clearGameState

        public void clearGameState()
        Clears the saved game state.

        Usually called at the end of a game

      • getGameState

        public Cursor getGameState()
        Returns a cursor located before the saved game state
        Returns:
        if getCount() == 0 then there is no state, if it's 1, then there is a saved game state

      • insertGameResult

        protected void insertGameResult(String white_name,
                    String black_name,
                    String moves,
                    String result,
                    Date date)
        Inserts a game result into the database
        Parameters:
        white_name - The white player's name
        black_name - The black player's name
        moves - A string representing the moves that were made
        result - The result(constants in this class)
        date - The date when the game was played

      • insertGameState

        public void insertGameState(String moves,
                   String whiteName,
                   String blackName,
                   String whiteTime,
                   String blackTime,
                   String bonus,
                   String time)
        This is used to store the game state for rebuilding.

        The method will automatically clear any already saved game states before inserting this one.

        Parameters:
        moves - The string of moves as defined by PositionHashFactory .getMoves()
        whiteName - White player's name
        blackName - Black player's name
        whiteTime - White player's remaining time
        blackTime - Black player's remaining time
        bonus - Bonus time per move
        time - Starting time per player

      • open

        public DBAdapter open()
               throws SQLException
        Open a writeable connection towards the database
        Returns:
        A DBAdapter object with an open connection towards the database
        Throws:
        SQLException

      • query

        protected Cursor query(String where,
           String having)
        Queries the database for the entries matching the parameter
        Parameters:
        where - A filter declaring which rows to return, formatted as an SQL WHERE clause (excluding the WHERE itself). Passing null will return all rows for the given table.

        having - A filter declare which row groups to include in the cursor, if row grouping is being used, formatted as an SQL HAVING clause (excluding the HAVING itself). Passing null will cause all row groups to be included, and is required when row grouping is not being used.
        Returns:
        A Cursor object positioned before the first entry
        See Also:
        SQLiteDatabase

      • updateTimes

        public void updateTimes(String whiteTime,
               String blackTime)
        Updates the player times for the stored game state
        Parameters:
        whiteTime - White's remaining time
        blackTime - Black's remaining time
